business.headline: IndiGo crisis, inflation, capacity: How Centre fixed Rs 7,500–18,000 fare capsIndia's Ministry of Civil Aviation has imposed emergency caps on domestic airfares following IndiGo's massive flight cancellations, aiming to protect passengers from soaring ticket prices during the peak travel season. This intervention seeks to stabilise the market amid one of the worst aviation disruptions in recent years.

Can RBI's liquidity boost give the sinking rupee a lifeboat?Liquidity can calm markets, not rewrite global conditions. As the rupee battles external shocks, will the RBI's latest push prove enough to anchor sentiment or simply slow an inevitable slide?

Noose tightens around Anil Ambani's Reliance Power as ED files chargesheetThe money laundering case is linked to the issuance of an alleged fake bank guarantee of Rs 68 crore for securing a Solar Energy Corporation of India tender.

Simone Tata, the quiet force behind Lakmé and Westside, dies at 95Simone Tata, a figure behind some of India's most recognizable retail and cosmetics brands, passed away at 95, leaving a legacy marked by innovation and leadership.

Lower lending rates ahead? From ICICI to SBI, your home loan rate checkIndia's central bank has reduced the repo rate by 25 basis points. This move is likely to influence home loan interest rates and stimulate activity across the housing and real estate sectors.

Netflix to buy Warner Bros Discovery's studios, streaming unit in $72 billion dealNetflix has agreed to buy Warner Bros Discovery's TV, film and streaming businesses, bringing the iconic studio under its control.

India's forex reserves decline for second week to $686.2 billion: ReportIndia's foreign exchange reserves fell for the second consecutive week, slipping by $1.877 billion to $686.227 billion in the week ended November 28, 2025.

Rs 1.2 lakh invested, only Rs 10,000 earned? The truth behind SIP mathsInvestors often overlook the real timeline of their investments when assessing SIP returns. Understanding the compounding effect and the actual period money stays invested can make a significant difference in evaluating returns.

Sensex, Nifty end higher as RBI cuts lending rate, offers liquidity supportThe Sensex ended at 85,712.37, up 447.05 points, while the Nifty50 settled at 26,186.45, gaining 152.70 points. Most of the broader market indices also ended the trading session on a positive note.

Victim of regulatory vacuum: Avadhut Sathe Training Academy denies allegationsSebi's interim order said the academy and its founder were running an unregistered investment advisory service under the guise of training programmes and had collected large sums of money from the public.

IndiGo flight cancellations: What passengers need to know about refundsIndiGo has informed the DGCA that full operational stabilisation is expected only by February 10, 2026, with continued cancellations anticipated until December 8.​

IndiGo crisis sends Delhi–Mumbai flight prices soaring to over Rs 80,000The Delhi–Mumbai corridor, which connects the national capital with the country's financial centre, is one of the busiest air routes globally. Any disruption on this route immediately affects business travellers, tourists, and daily commuters.

When two airlines rule the skies: Is India's aviation duopoly failing flyers?IndiGo's mass cancellations have exposed a deeper fault line in Indian aviation, where a growing duopoly means one airline's trouble can disrupt travel plans for the entire country.

Will personal loans become cheaper after the RBI's latest repo rate cut?Are borrowers finally set to get some relief as the RBI trims the repo rate by 25 basis points? Could this policy shift translate into lower personal loan rates soon? Read here.
Your FD investments to take a hit as RBI cuts repo rateIs your FD income set to shrink as banks prepare to reduce deposit rates after the RBI's rate cut? Let's have a look.

RBI reduces repo rate by 25 bps. Will your home loans get cheaper?RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra said the committee unanimously agreed on the rate cut after assessing inflation trends, growth forecasts and liquidity needs.

IndiGo shares tumble 2% as mass flight cancellations continue to disrupt travel IndiGo's stock fell over 2%, trading at Rs 5,326.35 by 10 am, amid mounting concerns over ongoing mass cancellations and delays across India's busiest airports.

RBI reduces key lending rate by 25 points to 5.25%, maintains neutral stanceThe rate cut takes the repo rate down from 5.5% to 5.25%. Alongside this, the Standing Deposit Facility (SDF) rate has been adjusted to 5%, while the Marginal Standing Facility (MSF) rate and the bank rate now stand at 5.5%.

Who is Avadhut Sathe, Pune finfluencer whose trading academy got banned by SebiSebi said that Avadhut Sathe Trading Academy was running an unregistered investment advisory business disguised as education, misleading investors through selective performance claims, paid WhatsApp groups, and live market recommendations.

Sensex, Nifty open flat as investors eye RBI's MPC decisionAround 9:36 am, the Sensex was down 60 points at 85,325, while the Nifty hovered just above the 26,000 mark with a modest 11 point gain. Broader market indices were largely in the red, reflecting the nervousness ahead of the policy outcome.

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss 19 Ep 105: Amaal, Pranit, Tanya get emotional reliving their journeys Farrhana Bhatt, Tanya Mittal, Amaal Mallik, Gaurav Khanna, and Pranit More are the top five finalists competing for the Bigg Boss 19 trophy, with the grand finale hosted by Salman Khan scheduled for December 7, 2025.

Katy Perry goes Instagram official with Justin Trudeau on Japan trip Pop star Katy Perry and former Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau publicly confirmed their relationship on Instagram, sharing photos from their recent trip to Japan, where they met former Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida.

Mammootty honours Mohanlal on Patriot set after Dadasaheb Phalke Award win The cast and crew of upcoming socio-political thriller Patriot marked Mohanlal's Dadasaheb Phalke Award with a special ceremony as anticipation builds for the film's 2026 release.

Is Taylor Swift marrying Travis Kelce in Rhode Island on June 13, 2026? Read here Singer Taylor Swift and NFL Travis Kelce's anticipated wedding is reportedly set for June 13, 2026, in Rhode Island. Reports suggest the couple have secured a luxury venue near Swift's Watch Hill property, with significant interest in the date and location.

Bigg Boss 19: Is Wikipedia screenshot leaking winner's name real? Fact check here Speculation intensified when a reported screenshot of Wikipedia featuring names of Bigg Boss 19 contestants went viral. The list even showed a winner, leaving fans debating authenticity of the claim.

Salman Khan, Chitrangda Singh's BTS moment from Battle of Galwan goes viral Actor Salman Khan has completed shooting for the war drama Battle of Galwan, which depicts the 2020 Galwan Valley clash between Indian and Chinese troops. The film, directed by Apoorva Lakhia, is inspired by true events detailed in India's Most Fearless 3 and features Khan in the role of Colonel B Santosh Babu.

Divya Khosla shuts down divorce buzz with Bhushan Kumar: Media really wants it Actor-filmmaker Divya Khosla Kumar openly discussed her experiences in Bollywood, her personal and professional life, and addressed ongoing rumours in a candid Reddit Ask Me Anything session.

Shaheer Sheikh reunites with Navya co-actor Somya Seth at her sister's wedding Shaheer Sheikh attended Prakriti Seth's wedding, reuniting with his former co-star Somya Seth. The actors were seen together in celebration, sharing moments from the ceremony on social media.

Qabool hai to saat pheras: Sara Khan and Krish Pathak wed in Hindu ceremony Actors Sara Khan and Krish Pathak celebrated their Hindu wedding ceremony on December 5, in Mumbai, following a court marriage earlier in October. The couple, who reportedly met on a dating app a year ago, welcomed friends and family to a reception marking the occasion.

Bigg Boss 19: Malti on equation with Amaal, and not bidding Pranit goodbye Actor-filmmaker Malti Chahar was evicted from Bigg Boss 19 following a tense fallout with friends inside the house. Her exit has sparked discussions about friendship and manipulation dynamics on the show.

Dhurandhar box office day 1: Film earns over Rs 28 crore as per official estimates Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar earned over Rs 28 crore at the box office per official estimates. The film is a spy-thriller also featuring Akshaye Khanna, Sanjay Dutt, Arjun Rampal and Sara Arjun in key roles.

Justin Baldoni told pregnant Blake Lively he was circumcised; says she never asked Court documents revealed Justin Baldoni acknowledged discussing his circumcision status with Blake Lively during a visit to her New York home in 2022, a detail now central in Lively's harassment lawsuit tied to the production of 'It Ends With Us'.

Pardesi: An Indo-Russian romance disguised as 15th-Century adventure As part of our Retro Review series, we revisit Pardesi (1957), a pioneering Indo-Soviet film portraying a 15th-century Russian trader's journey to India. Beyond romance, it symbolises enduring India-Russia friendship across centuries and cultures

Priyanka Chopra backs Janhvi Kapoor's message on equality. Read her shoutout here On Friday, Priyanka Chopra shared a video of Janhvi Kapoor discussing gender equality, using her platform to echo Kapoor's call for conversations and awareness around women's rights.

Akhanda 2: Makers apologise amid indefinite delay. Check update on new release date Nandamuri Balakrishna's highly anticipated film Akhanda 2, initially set for a December 4 debut, has been postponed indefinitely as the production team addresses unforeseen challenges. The makers have issued an apology to fans and committed to announcing a new release date soon.

Christopher Nolan led film body to meet Netflix after its Warner Bros acquisition The Directors Guild of America, led by Christopher Nolan, will meet with Netflix to discuss concerns about the streamer's potential acquisition of Warner Bros. Discovery, following news of exclusive talks between the companies.

Schooled by Salman, how Pranit More turned humour into Bigg Boss 19 finale ticket After facing host Salman Khan's wrath on the first Weekend Ka Vaar for his "under-the-belt jokes" on him, RJ-turned-stand-up comedian Pranit More has turned his humour into his armour. Now among the five finalists of Bigg Boss 19, More went on to gel with his "group" and built rapport with his The Pranit More Show. He took stands against "bullies", and is now being backed even by some Maharashtra politicians.

Remember faces trying to fix: Sonu Sood backs IndiGo staff amid cancellation chaos Actor Sonu Sood has called on the public to treat Indigo Airlines staff with kindness and patience amid flight delays. He shared a video message in which he asked travellers to remain humble and considerate despite frustrations related to flight delays.

Ranveer Singh's flirty comment on Deepika's date night look steals the show Ranveer Singh shared a flirty comment on Deepika Padukone's date night look. The latter also shared a note on Ranveer's new film - 'Dhurandhar'.

general news.headline: 23 killed in massive cylinder blast in Goa nightclub, PM Modi offers condolencesThe fire broke out around midnight at Birch by Romeo Lane, a club in Baga, one of Goa's most popular beaches, following a cylinder blast, and the police said most of the victims appear to be staff members.

Flight chaos: Aviation body issues notice to IndiGo CEO, seeks reply in 24 hoursIndia's aviation sector faces a severe crisis as IndiGo grapples with massive flight cancellations and delays, prompting regulatory action. Passengers endure significant inconvenience while authorities and rival airlines step in to manage the disruption.

Toss, match, and series. Ruthless India rout South Africa in Vizag ODI deciderIndia vs South Africa, 3rd ODI: Yashasvi Jaiswal's maiden ODI hundred and fifties from Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma helped India chase 271 in just 39.5 overs in the series finale. Kuldeep Yadav and Prasidh Krishna picked four wickets each as South Africa were bowled out for 270, at least 80 runs short of a par total on a dewy evening in Visakhapatnam.

Biryani feast, Saudi clerics: Suspended TMC MLA lays 'Babri Masjid' stoneSuspended Trinamool Congress MLA Humayun Kabir laid the foundation stone for a Babri Masjid-style mosque in Bengal's communally sensitive Murshidabad amid heavy security presence.

Even 'good girls' wear makeup in India. Thanks to Simone TataWhether you're a Gen-Z shopper whose fashion staples are incomplete without Westside and Zudio, or a Gen-X or Millennial who grew up watching India's changing relationship with makeup, Simone Tata has touched your life in more ways than you may realise.

Did Centre succumb to IndiGo's pressure? Aviation Minister respondsEarlier this week, severe disruptions hit IndiGo services and resulted in more than 1,500 flights being cancelled over the last four days.

IndiGo chaos reminds people of Putin asserting state's power; 2009 clip goes viralThe nationwide chaos triggered by IndiGo's flight cancellations came amid Russian President Vladimir Putin's visit to India. The allegations that IndiGo arm‑twisted the DGCA to relax duty-time rules made people share a 2009 video of Putin, then Russian PM, humiliating a billionaire oligarch for not paying workers for months. In the clip, Putin is seen forcing him to sign an agreement, reminding everyone that the state holds ultimate power.

Stay in your domain: Gambhir slams IPL team owner, media in epic rantGautam Gambhir defended his coaching amid criticism following India's ODI series win against South Africa. He criticised an IPL owner for interfering with team decisions, highlighting challenges faced in Test cricket.

How IndiGo's chaos is wrecking India's wedding seasonWeddings are built on months of planning and emotion, and for countless families, friends, and even the bride and groom, one IndiGo collapse was enough to bring it all crashing down.

Engaging atmosphere reigned: Shashi Tharoor on state dinner with PutinSenior Congress leader Shashi Tharoor described the Rashtrapati Bhavan banquet for Russian President Vladimir Putin as a warm and engaging event, highlighting his positive interactions with the Russian delegation.

Russia launches massive missile and drone attack on Ukraine amid talks to end warRussia launched 51 missiles and 653 drones at Ukraine, injuring at least eight and hitting energy sites, as peace talks with US officials continue amid efforts to end the war.

FIFA World Cup 2026 schedule revealed: Here's when Messi and Ronaldo start final runThe FIFA World Cup 2026 schedule is finally out as the first-ever 48-team edition takes shape. With matches spread across the USA, Mexico, and Canada, the tournament promises the biggest global spectacle football has ever seen.

Katy Perry goes Instagram official with Justin Trudeau on Japan tripPop star Katy Perry and former Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau publicly confirmed their relationship on Instagram, sharing photos from their recent trip to Japan, where they met former Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida.

Country's first case for providing false details in SIR registered in UPIn a unique case in Uttar Pradesh, a family has been FIRed for submitting false details in voter list update forms. This highlights the strict enforcement of electoral transparency in Rampur district.

Rohit Sharma emulates Virat Kohli, becomes 4th Indian batter to 20,000 runsRohit Sharma achieved a major milestone by crossing 20,000 runs in international cricket. This feat places him among India's elite batters and highlights his dominance in white-ball formats.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Schooled by Salman, how Pranit More turned humour into Bigg Boss 19 finale ticketAfter facing host Salman Khan's wrath on the first Weekend Ka Vaar for his "under-the-belt jokes" on him, RJ-turned-stand-up comedian Pranit More has turned his humour into his armour. Now among the five finalists of Bigg Boss 19, More went on to gel with his "group" and built rapport with his The Pranit More Show. He took stands against "bullies", and is now being backed even by some Maharashtra politicians.

Girl, 13, dies by suicide, family alleges harassment by senior at schoolA tragic incident in Akola city highlights the severe consequences of harassment faced by a young schoolgirl, leading to her untimely death. This case underscores the urgent need for stronger protective measures and mental health support in schools across Maharashtra.

IndiGo crisis: PMO in touch with CEO, ministry summons top officials, fares cappedIndiGo cancellations: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has been briefed on the IndiGo crisis, which has seen over a thousand flights being cancelled in the last few days, and his office is in direct touch with CEO Pieter Elbers.

Tata Sierra prices revealed for all variants except the top two. Check pricesTata Motors has revealed prices for most of the variants of the Sierra except the top two variants following its debut last month, as the iconic SUV prepares for bookings in mid-December and deliveries in January.

Dhurandhar, Saiyaara, Pushpa: Why are our heroes toxic, broken, bad at boundariesA hard-hitting look at Bollywood's rising obsession with toxic, broody heroes, from Dhurandhar to Tere Ishk Mein. Why do audiences continue to romanticise red flags as passion?

Highlights: IndiGo ramps up to 1,500 flights; says 95% network restoredIndiGo Flights Cancellations Highlights: IndiGo faces a major operational crisis, cancelling over 850 flights today, leaving thousands stranded. The aviation ministry has ordered refunds by Sunday and instructed baggage reunification and dedicated support cells. Congress blamed the government's alleged push for a duopoly and rollback of pilot safety norms, calling it a government-made disaster. IndiGo said it is stabilising schedules, reducing delays, and prioritising refunds, while thanking staff for efforts. Regulatory scrutiny and public frustration continue as the airline works to restore normalcy.

Ex-Pentagon official says Trump deserves Nobel for uniting India and RussiaFormer Pentagon official Michael Rubin says Donald Trump deserves a Nobel Prize for bringing India and Russia closer. He also criticised Trump's handling of ties with India, which have been rocky.

No calls, emails after work: Right to Disconnect Bill introduced in Lok SabhaThe bill proposes granting every employee the right to disconnect from work-related calls and emails beyond official work hours and on holidays.

Mammootty honours Mohanlal on Patriot set after Dadasaheb Phalke Award winThe cast and crew of upcoming socio-political thriller Patriot marked Mohanlal's Dadasaheb Phalke Award with a special ceremony as anticipation builds for the film's 2026 release.

Salman Khan, Chitrangda Singh's BTS moment from Battle of Galwan goes viralActor Salman Khan has completed shooting for the war drama Battle of Galwan, which depicts the 2020 Galwan Valley clash between Indian and Chinese troops. The film, directed by Apoorva Lakhia, is inspired by true events detailed in India's Most Fearless 3 and features Khan in the role of Colonel B Santosh Babu.

sports.headline: FIFA World Cup 2026 schedule revealed: Here's when Messi and Ronaldo start final run The FIFA World Cup 2026 schedule is finally out as the first-ever 48-team edition takes shape. With matches spread across the USA, Mexico, and Canada, the tournament promises the biggest global spectacle football has ever seen.

India vs South Africa: Nikhil Naz Analyses India's Bowling Performance in Series Decider In this Special Report, India Today's Consulting Editor (Sports) Nikhil Naz analyses the crucial 3rd ODI between India and South Africa in Visakhapatnam. Naz highlights the significance of India finally winning the toss after a gap of 20 matches, terming it a 'massive relief' for captain KL Rahul. He explains how the 'dew' factor makes the toss vital, giving the chasing team a distinct advantage. The editor praises the bowling efforts of Kuldeep Yadav and Prasidh Krishna, who restricted the visitors to 270 runs—the first sub-300 total of the series. Naz notes that despite South Africa's strong start, India's disciplined bowling in the middle overs has placed them in the 'driver's seat' to win the series decider.

India vs South Africa: Kuldeep Yadav, Prasidh Krishna Pick 4 Wickets Each; De Kock Hits 7th Ton On this match analysis, the focus is on the ODI series between India and South Africa, where the Proteas were dismissed for 270. The speaker highlights the performance of Kuldeep Yadav and Prasidh Krishna, noting that 'the duo picked four wickets each'. The report details Kuldeep Yadav's comments on a new rule allowing only one ball between the 34th and 50th overs, which helped him exploit dry conditions. The programme also discusses Quinton de Kock's seventh ODI century against India and his impressive conversion rate.

Rant, relief and praise: Gautam Gambhir's fiery Vizag presser had it all India vs South Africa, 3rd ODI: Gautam Gambhir lashed out at an IPL team owner for suggesting split coaching, praised his players for bouncing back to win the ODI series, and reiterated his views on white-ball tactics in a fiery press conference that had it all on Saturday, December 6.

Max Verstappen storms to pole for title-deciding Abu Dhabi Grand Prix Formula 1: Max Verstappen delivered a flawless lap to seal pole for the title-deciding Abu Dhabi Grand Prix. With Norris and Piastri close behind, the championship fight now sets up a thrilling showdown at Yas Marina.

Stay in your domain: Gambhir slams IPL team owner, media in epic rant Gautam Gambhir defended his coaching amid criticism following India's ODI series win against South Africa. He criticised an IPL owner for interfering with team decisions, highlighting challenges faced in Test cricket.

Watch: Virat Kohli paaji latest guest in Arshdeep Singh's viral Instagram reel IND vs SA: Arshdeep Singh had India stalwart Virat Kohli feature in one of his viral Instagram reels after the win in Visakhapatnam. The Player of the Series joined in the fun fresh off a dominant campaign, having scored 302 runs in three matches.

Ro-Ko bromance in Vizag: Rohit hugs Virat after India seal series win IND vs SA: Rohit Sharma wrapped Virat Kohli in a celebratory hug as India eased to a nine-wicket win in the third ODI in Vizag, their composed half-centuries setting up the series clincher against South Africa.

India Win ODI Series: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma Silence Critics with Dominant Performance In this special report, the focus is on India's remarkable ODI series victory, coming just weeks after a Test series loss. The discussion highlights how icons Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli silenced critics with stellar performances, with Kohli averaging 151 and winning Man of the Series. The programme also analyses Yashasvi Jaiswal's timely century and the depth of the Indian squad, noting that regular captain Shubman Gill is set to return once fit. The aggressive approach of the team is also examined.

Another peak at 36? Virat Kohli says liberated mindset driving best phase in years Virat Kohli delivered a stellar performance in India's 2-1 ODI series win over South Africa. His record-breaking run tally and Player of the Series award highlight a remarkable resurgence in ODI cricket.

How Ro-Ko helped Yashasvi Jaiswal rediscover form and hit his maiden ODI hundred Vizag centurion Yashasvi Jaiswal expressed his gratitude after scoring his maiden ODI hundred, explaining how senior pros Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli helped steady his nerves during India's 271-run chase against South Africa at the ACA-VDCA Cricket Stadium on Saturday.

Toss, match, and series. Ruthless India rout South Africa in Vizag ODI deciderIndia vs South Africa, 3rd ODI: Yashasvi Jaiswal's maiden ODI hundred and fifties from Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma helped India chase 271 in just 39.5 overs in the series finale. Kuldeep Yadav and Prasidh Krishna picked four wickets each as South Africa were bowled out for 270, at least 80 runs short of a par total on a dewy evening in Visakhapatnam.

Yashasvi Jaiswal becomes sixth Indian to hit a hundred in all three formatsYoung opener Yashasvi Jaiswal notched up his maiden ODI hundred to put India in a commanding position to win the third ODI and inch closer to sealing the series 2-1 against South Africa at the ACA-VDCA Cricket Stadium in Visakhapatnam on Saturday.

England won't ditch aggressive batting style despite Gabba collapse: TrescothickAshes: England assistant coach Marcus Trescothick reiterated the team's commitment to its attacking batting style despite another difficult day at the Gabba.

Rohit Sharma emulates Virat Kohli, becomes 4th Indian batter to 20,000 runsRohit Sharma achieved a major milestone by crossing 20,000 runs in international cricket. This feat places him among India's elite batters and highlights his dominance in white-ball formats.

Prasidh Krishna's critics get a stern message from R Ashwin after Vizag ODI heroicsIndia vs South Africa, 3rd ODI: Former India spinner R Ashwin talked up the quality of Prasidh Krishna, saying it's unfair to judge the Karnataka fast bowler based on one match. Prasidh took four wickets as India bowled South Africa out for 270 on Saturday in Visakhapatnam.

Watch: Rohit Sharma back with DRS banter with Kuldeep Yadav in Vizag ODIIND vs SA: Rohit Sharma's playful DRS banter with Kuldeep Yadav stole the show in Vizag. His sharp judgment and light-hearted presence lifted India's energy during the crucial third ODI against South Africa.

No Root magic as England stare at humiliating defeat after Starc all-round showAshes, 2nd Test, Day 3: Australia edged towards another win in the pink ball Test at The Gabba after England crashed to 134 for 6 in their second innings, still 43 runs short of making the hosts bat again. Earlier, Australia's lower order extended the lead to 177 before their bowlers used the evening conditions to rip through England's top order.

Who is Lindblad? Prodigy with Indian roots all set for F1 bow with RB Visa AppArvid Lindblad is all set to make his Formula One bow as part of the RB Visa App team. Lindblad has Indian roots, having visited the country last year along with his family.

Watch: Rohit Sharma rolls back the years with top-notch fielding in Vizag ODIIND vs SA: Rohit Sharma's electric fielding in Vizag reminded fans of his younger days. His diving stop and crucial catch reignited India's momentum in the must-win ODI against South Africa.

Pat Cummins gives green light for Adelaide Test return: I'll be good to goPat Cummins has given himself the green light to take part in the Adelaide Test for Australia during the Ashes 2025-26. Cummins has been out of competitive action since July this year.

Quinton de Kock equals Jayasuriya's record with his 7th ODI hundred vs IndiaSouth Africa wicketkeeper Quinton de Kock drew level with former Sri Lanka captain Sanath Jayasuriya by scoring his seventh ODI hundred as an opener against India during the third ODI in Vizag.

Mitchell Starc continues to rule Brisbane with batting heroics, goes past BroadMitchell Starc continued his golden run in the Ashes 2025 with a well-compiled 77 that helped him add a new record to his name in Test cricket. Starc's innings helped Australia to take a 177-run lead in the match.

KKR power coach Andre Russell reaches 500 T20 wickets, joins Narine in elite listAndre Russell added a new accolade to his storied T20 career as he got his 500th wicket in the format during the match between ADKR and Desert Vipers in the ILT20 on Friday, December 5.

Shubman Gill cleared to play SA T20I series, gets fitness certificate from COEIndia captain Shubman Gill has been declared fully fit after completing rehabilitation at BCCI Centre of Excellence. He's now cleared to play in the upcoming T20I series against South Africa, beginning on December 9.

Sreejesh critical of India after Belgium shootout win: They will get a mouthfulPR Sreejesh was critical of his side's performance in the quarter-final of the Jr. Men's Hockey World Cup despite securing a thrilling shootout win over against Belgium on Friday, December 5.

India end Washington Sundar experiment, bring in Tilak Varma for 3rd ODIIND vs SA: India have dropped Washington Sundar for the final ODI against South Africa, bringing in Tilak Varma. Varma last played ODIs in December 2023.

Big laugh, Vizag erupts: KL Rahul punches the air as India end toss draughtIndia vs South Africa 3rd ODI: KL Rahul was pumped as Vizag erupted after India finally ended their toss drought after 21 attempts in the match against South Africa on Saturday, December 6.

AUS vs ENG: Star Wars' Stormtroopers back in attendance at GabbaAshes: Did you stop the Star Wars stormtroopers at the Gabba. The 'GabbaTroopers' were once again in attendance in the Brisbane Test match creating an incredible environment for the fans.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
